pageTitle: What is your primary body for wildlife photography? | Nikonians
textBeforeTable: Fri 18-Jan-13 01:26 AMJim PearceWhat is your primary body for wildlife photography? [View all] AlertQuoteReply Visit my Nikonians gallery. Jim, Thank you for posing this question. I sold my D300S and committed to the D800 to avoid carrying two camera bodies when I am out with potential for wildlife and/or landscape photos. Also, I have missed some great photo opportunities when wildlife suddenly appeared, which they tend to do, but too close for my DX / telephoto combo in hand. My thoughts thus far with regard to bird photography...I like the D800 better for including more environment given the same lens and distance to subject. However, I am not convinced about the detail in bird feathers when I get in tight. For me, I have not consistently matched the lovely detail in bird feathers that I could routinely expect with my D300S. For now, I , , | |
